## The Framework
We present a unified physical model where spacetime, matter, and the dark sector emerge from the hydrodynamics of a single relativistic superfluid vacuum.

By modeling the vacuum as a condensate with nonlinear saturation, we demonstrate that:
1.  **Gravity** is the acoustic metric of the fluid's density fluctuations.
2.  **Matter** consists of stable topological defects (vortices/knots).
3.  **Dark Energy** is the internal pressure of the background field.

This project provides rigorous numerical and symbolic validation of the hypothesis, bridging the gap between hydrodynamic intuition and precision cosmology.

## Validated Results (Phase 2)

::: {.grid}

::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-4}
### 1. Solar System Precision
Symbolic derivation confirms the Post-Newtonian parameter **$\gamma = 1$**, matching General Relativity's light deflection without screening mechanisms.
[See Derivation &rarr;](simulations/08_ppn_gamma.html)
:::

::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-4}
### 2. Dark Matter as AQUAL
The effective Lagrangian naturally transitions to a non-linear **AQUAL regime** ($X^2$) at low accelerations, mimicking galactic rotation curves.
[Explore MOND &rarr;](simulations/09_mond_regime.html)
:::

::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-4}
### 3. Dark Energy Dynamics
Cosmological simulations predict a **Thawing Quintessence** equation of state ($w_0 \approx -1$), fully consistent with Planck 2018 constraints.
[View Cosmic History &rarr;](simulations/11_cosmic_history.html)
:::
